New Records: Weston Wilson drove in the tiebreaking run with an infield single down the third-base line, and the Philadelphia Phillies beat the Tampa Rays 3-2 on Wednesday night to complete a three-game sweep.
Key Match Events: Weston Wilson drove in the tiebreaking run with an infield single down the third-base line
Zack Wheeler struck out nine batters over six innings
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies reduced their magic number to clinch their first National League East title since 2011 to nine.
Kyle Schwarber was scratched after feeling discomfort in his left elbow during batting practice.
Post-Match Reflections: Weston Wilson said, "I think it’s a testament to how we take care of business down there."
Castellanos said, "I have respect for Cash for being honest and (manning) up."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies got game-winning hits from Kody Clemens and Cal Stevenson in the first two games of the series.
Buddy Kennedy had a key walk to set up Clemens' game-wining hit on Monday and an RBI hit replacing Schwarber on Tuesday.
Others: Major League Baseball originally suspended Uceta for three games and Tampa manager Kevin Cash for one game Wednesday afternoon. Uceta’s suspension was later reduced to two games.
